Name: barite production | barite | EN15804GD, U
Category: B:Mining and quarrying/07:Mining of metal ores/072:Mining of non-ferrous metal ores/0729:Mining of other non-ferrous metal ores
Description: Barite is mined both in open pit and underground mines. About 60 to 120 kg of Barite can be yielded from one cubic meter of ore. The ore is transported via lorry (usually less than 5km) to a washing installation. Subsequently, it is separated from the water and grinded wet or dry. Between 65% and 85% of barite contained in the ore can be extracted. This dataset includes resource extraction and processing of the material.
